snippet.title: Samoa, Guam, Tahiti confirmed as bidders for 2019 Pacific Games
snippet.content: The deadline has passed for those nations wanting to step into the breach left by Tonga, and take over hosting rights for the Pacific Games in 2019. And three countries have thrown their hats into the ring, Guam, Samoa, and the late arrival at the party, Tahiti. Meanwhile the Chief Executive of the Pacific Games Council, Andrew Minogue, is offering reassurance over a financial blow out for Solomon Islands ahead of their hosting the Games in 2023, and he says the immediate focus is on finding a new home for 2019 as soon as possible.
